website_summaries.verdict: For longer distances, this is the boot you need.
pros: These comfortable, lightweight boots will take you miles without blisters or pain
The GORE-TEX lining keeps water out well, and customers love that the lacing stays tight after a full day of hiking
cons: These run narrow and are uncomfortable for some as a result

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic boots. Have only used them on long day hikes so far but am impressed with how comfortable and sturdy they are. Comfortable right out of the box, which is a new experience for me. No blisters or hot spots at all. Update on June 22, 2016: Just did a four day, 35 mile Olympic National Park trek with these boots, carrying a heavy pack, ice axe, crampons, etc, and am thoroughly impressed. No hotspots, no blisters. Crossed lots of streams, snowfields and wet areas and my feet stayed dry and comfortable. Excellent craftsmanship. These are solid, well-made boots and my new favorite gear item. Extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth G. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: great boot, break them in...
customer_reviews.text: very good boots i wore them around the house for a few weeks a few hours every day i hoped this would help break them in it did however i took them out on the first hike and went almost 7 miles maybe a little to much for first hike i also had about 25lbs in my pack as well, so I'm sure this did not help other than that very good boots stiff but soft and very supportive i will update with more usage UPDATE.... been wearing around the house every day and just took them out for the second big hike 6 miles and no hot spots great boot break them in
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not For Wide Feet
customer_reviews.text: Gave it 3 stars because the wide was not wide enough. Have a pair of Lowa's Renegade and the wide is a perfect fit for me. Unfortunately the Camino wide is not as wide. Overall, it is a well made heavy boot. If you have wide feet and have purchased other Lowa's in wide.this boot will probably not fit. I did notice that though the box it came in has a "Wide" sticker, the inside tongue of the shoe did not indicate "wide" as the Renegade does. Oh well - it was returned on my penny. Stuff happens. Still a fan of Lowa.
customer_reviews.author: Jazmine

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking boots, just a little too small. Went with a half size larger and it's great. My feet are a little wider than average for their length, so I typically have to go a half size larger for all shoes.
customer_reviews.author: smarties-pants

customer_reviews.title: May be a good quality but certainly not a good fit, too narrow and a size small.
customer_reviews.text: The built seems to be good (I didn't use them though), but too narrow and runs quite small. My size is 7 and i bought 7.5 and still it was very tight, my toe fingers just couldn't move, had I tried using them I am sure would have suffered a lot. Had to return them. In width also it seems to be quite narrow but may not very uncomfortable though, but I don't understand why they made it so!
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Trust worthy pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: I first came across this pair of boots from the review at Military Moron.com so I decided to get them for the sandy, dusty, rocky, slippery slopes of Kilimanjaro and I must say it performed magnificently. They do not need a lot of running-in (as least for me) and very comfortable to put on. They are light and waterproofed as well. Buy a half size larger if you know you are going to wear super thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: BoonW_SG

customer_reviews.title: pricey but worth the dow
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot!!! Amazon was GREAT!! i purchased and returned 3 other pairs of hiking boots until i found this perfect pair. Yes they are pricey but i believe that a comfortable boot with support is worth every penny after a long day of hiking. Break in period was minimal. All feet are different so i suggest try different boots and if you have any pain at all return the boots and get a different brand or style. For me these boots ROCK MY WORLD and my feet are in heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Samcro

customer_reviews.title: Great boots or greatest boots?
customer_reviews.text: I just love Lowa boots. I finally had to replace my first pair of Lowa's after 17 years (of light use), and these are more of an upgrade than I imagined. They did not not breaking in. They fit perfectly and my first 10 mile hike resulted in not a single complaint. I also really love the lacing system. They kept my feet warm into the single digits. The soles have incredible traction. I could go on!
customer_reviews.author: IceAero

customer_reviews.title: I found that a week is a good approximate break in period for these boots give or ...
customer_reviews.text: After talking to a Lowa rep about these boots, I found that a week is a good approximate break in period for these boots give or take some time. In my particular case the break in was about three days. Now they fit like a glove and I have comfort, protection and a good tool for my feet. Thank you Lowa for your customer service, and for making such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: The size 12 is perfect on my 11
customer_reviews.text: I knew from owning a pair of Lowa Ticam's that I'd need to order the boot a half size large. The size 12 is perfect on my 11.5 feet. I tried on a few other brands thinking I might save 50 or 100 dollars but the Lowa's felt perfect on my feet and the quality is evident. The lacing system makes it easy to fit the boot to whatever suits your feet. I love the stride in these boots, they don't feel clunky or awkward like some boots.
customer_reviews.author: Dave O.

customer_reviews.title: Love LOWA boots
customer_reviews.text: Love LOWA boots. The Camino is no different. A well built and well supported boot for backpacking or mountain travels, The boot is bomber durable and the rubber rand provides protection when crossing scree fields. Great purchase I would recommend to any of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: O.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Supporting Boot
customer_reviews.text: I picked these based on recommendations that these sized narrower than normal, and they provided excellent over pronation support. I have narrow and flat feet. We're planning our third hike into the Grand Canyon, and foot support is critical. These are a great improvement over my current boots. I've worn them for two weeks straight to break them in, and they felt ready to go right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: McPack

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boots! Break in period for me was about ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing boots! Break in period for me was about a week of just walking around town. These are by far the hottest pair of boots I own. I live in Idaho and purchased these for ice fishing and wow are they warm with just a cheap thin cotton sock. The way this boot laces is absolutely brilliant and a true hiker will appreciate it. I have a pair of the Zephyrs and love them even more than these.
customer_reviews.author: Purehate

customer_reviews.title: I wore them on a 3 hour 7ish mile hike through a redwood forest with good results. This was the first time wearing them ...
customer_reviews.text: Though early on to make a full assessment, I wore them on a 3 hour 7ish mile hike through a redwood forest with good results. This was the first time wearing them with thick hiking socks (Smart Wool) and they were supportive, very comfortable, and grippy. This hike had a pretty steep ascent for the first 1.5 miles and wound into down hill switchbacks beyond that. So far so good; next step will be to wear them with a weighted pack. I am planning a Nepal Trek with these and now I am in the break-in stage with the new boots.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boot
customer_reviews.text: In the last six months, my boots have travelled far and right out of the box, these were comfortable, supportive and waterproof. No blisters, comfortable footbed, durable and tough - I don't think they even have a blemish on them despite the miles I've logged in them. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Francois M.

customer_reviews.title: I have flat feet and over pronate, I did ...
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet and over pronate, I did alot of research looking for a supportive pair of hiking boots. I settled on these boots. At first the price shocked me, I will tell you right now, they are worth it. The broke in quickly and are extremely supportive. However they do fit a little narrow so if any doubt get the wide pair.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for a stiff boot.
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. I have a foot condition, metatarsalgia, and very few boots work for me. These do! Very comfortable for a stiff boot.
customer_reviews.author: twood

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Boots
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I could wear these as slippers or lounge shoes. They are that comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Manfrenjensenden

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: I use these boots for snowshoeing and I have narrow feet . I am happy with these boots for the excellent and snug fit and also because my feet stay dry even in the most wet conditions
customer_reviews.author: Davy

customer_reviews.title: Only two days in, but...
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love them. First day out, did 12 miles and 4000 ft net ascent, including up and down some nasty scree fields. Second day, did another 2500 ft over 6 miles, much of it wet rock. Traction 9/10, dryness 10/10, support / stability 10/10, durability - hard to say at this point, but I hammered them over two days and no sign of weakness yet. We'll see. For now, I would highly recommend them to anyone looking for a fairly burly but relatively light hard core hiking boot for the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: they are comfortable, beautiful and excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've tried different paths without being tired of my feet, legs and back, they are comfortable, beautiful and excellent design
customer_reviews.author: Wolf1IY

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME. BOOTS
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boots! Great support. I have a partial right foot due to motorcycle accident and these boots with the full shank work fantastic. THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: K. GRAY

customer_reviews.title: a gift for my son
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son. Wow, aren't I a good mom, after I kept from choking at the price tag! But they are Lowa boots which means they are a good quality boot which should last him for years to come. I hope! They have held up very well. Even when he unintentionally soaked them when he got caught by a sneaker wave on the Oregon coast. They shed water well, ocean water at that! His brother's Keen hiking boots didn't fare as well as these did in the waves. I don't recommend wearing these or any hiking boot to the beach however.
customer_reviews.author: Jots

customer_reviews.title: Narrow
customer_reviews.text: These seem like great quality but the fit is very, very narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking this boots to Spain to do Camino De Santiago. I have done back to back 12 miles hikes with no problems. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Spargo CXVII

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !
customer_reviews.text: Those boots are comfortables and very stables on rocks. They are sticky on rocks. They look nice and hot during fall.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie Poirier

customer_reviews.title: Finally found my go-to Boot!!
customer_reviews.text: So, I tried the Salomon Quest 4D II's. Loved them to death but could not solve a hotspot on the outside edge of my left foot. Even tried a 1/2 size larger, no luck. I end up biting the bullet and forking over $299 for these Lowa boots. They are 100% bomb proof! Super comfortable out of the box and look awesome to boot (got black and orange). I highly recommend these boots from shear build quality as I haven't put them to test on the trails just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These fit my foot perfectly and are some of the most comfortable boots I have tried on
customer_reviews.text: Have a somewhat narrow foot and have heard that Lowa's have narrow fit. These fit my foot perfectly and are some of the most comfortable boots I have tried on.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo

customer_reviews.title: Not Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Good - The Camino's construction appears flawless. Seems very ruggedly made, and would last for many miles. The fit was good enough to go for several miles with no blisters/hot spots. They are a nice looking boot. Bad - They just aren't very comfortable. The insole is very thin. My heel felt bruised after my first day with them. I tried the green and orange Superfeet and SofSole insoles, but they didn't improve the feel enough to make me happy about wearing the Caminos. These boots have been retired to the closet after just a few days of wear.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for winter backpacking treks and they are ideal. Feet stayed dry, good support and very comfortable. I went one full size larger to accommodate two pair of thick socks. I would recommend these to anyone looking for serious gear to use in rugged conditions. These would not be suitable as casual wear or city winter boots but I highly recommend for serious backpacking treks.
customer_reviews.author: Nik S

customer_reviews.title: I love my Lowa
customer_reviews.text: The Lowa Camino GTX I order fit just perfect. They are as confortable as my sleepers. The shoes laces system is very effective and makes it possible to put and remove the boots more easily. Bravo Lowa! Mes Lowa Camino GTX que j'ai commandé sont exactement de la bonne grandeur. Elles sont aussi confortables que mes pantoufles. Le système de lacet avec billes est très utile et permet de mettre et d'enlever les bottes facilement. Bravo Lowa!
customer_reviews.author: Marcel G

customer_reviews.title: Too soon to say as it takes a good amount of miles to determine wear and tear
customer_reviews.text: Too soon to say as it takes a good amount of miles to determine wear and tear. They fit fine but are a bit stiff heel to toe and could use a softer insole
customer_reviews.author: Ted N Thornburgh Sr

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: @ 1st very impressed than above the toes the material bunched up on both shoes making them to painful to wear!
customer_reviews.author: Clint D.

customer_reviews.title: Cause ankles to roll in at completion of step. ...
customer_reviews.text: Cause ankles to roll in at completion of step. It is a very pronounced drop and would need to instability on trail. Already have ankle issues and this just adds to it. All other aspects of boot are quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: The Lowa Camino GTX boots are of superior quality and design. I agree with reviewers about their excellent comfort and lacing system. I purchased these boots because reviewers said that German made boots are built on wider lasts. These boots are made in Italy, and in my opinion are a "regular" fit . I did go one size up. Oh well. I really like these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Mike.PasoRobles

customer_reviews.title: men's lowa camino gtx boots
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these boots for two reasons, first i ordered a pair of lowa renegades a couple months back and they were a bit to tight, then i emailed lowa and they replied their 2ee size is actually between an e and a ee. so with the caminos gtx's i went up a half size with an extra e, making it an 8.5ee; they're still tight, but since i have more wiggle room in the toe box I'm hoping that within a month the boots will stretch out. if not ill be going to my local red wing boot dealer and buying a pair of boots that are suitable for 'packing.
customer_reviews.author: millerwatch

customer_reviews.title: best boots I own
customer_reviews.text: I own 40 pair of hiking and hunting boots and these Lowa Camino GTX are the best fitting best soled,most comfortable boots I have. I own every highline boots made , Zamberlan,Kayland, Meindl,Crispi,Kenetrek etc and none compare to the sure footedness of the Lowa Camino GTX . THE BEST
customer_reviews.author: damon lorber

customer_reviews.title: smaller size than normal
customer_reviews.text: received shoes and fount they are smaller than normal 7.5 size. i would have bought half size bigger. as i live in Canada, i decide not to contact Amazon for exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Zhenrong Qian

product_meta.title: Lowa Men's Camino GTX Hiking Boot
product_meta.description:
Ideal for long-distance treks with a midweight pack, the LOWA Camino GTX Hiking Boot helps you log miles as comfortably as possible. Featuring a lightweight sole, slimmed-down shank, and free movement lacing all the way to the toe. This design reduces strain across the toes, especially going downhill. These hiking boots are ideal for trekking on- and off-trail.

MEN'S CAMINO GTX 
HIKING BOOT
AT A GLANCE:
 * Ideal for long-distance treks and thru-hikes with a midweight pack
 * Waterproof, breathable GORE-TEX lining reduces hot spots
 * X-lacing with locking eyelets for custom fit
 * Pronounced front heel edge provides good downhill traction
 * Vibram outsole with thick lugs designed for backpacking

CAMINO GTX
This nimble trekker provides knee and back support for carrying mid-weight (30-50 pound) packs on off trail, overnight adventures. View larger.

 The Camino's flexible nubuck leather upper securely holds the foot in place reducing strain on the toes during downhill sections. View larger. 

FLEXIBLE UPPER AND LIGHTWEIGHT MIDSOLE FOR STABILITY
 The Camino's flexible nubuck leather upper securely holds the foot in place reducing strain on the toes during downhill sections. The PU midsole provides extra cushioning, and microfiber inserts support your foot's natural roll-off motion. 

WATERPROOF GORE-TEX KEEPS FEET DRY
 The Camino features breathable, waterproof GORE-TEX lining that reduces hot spots so your feet stay comfortable in warmer temperatures as well as in cold, wet conditions. 

VIBRAM OUTSOLE WITH THICK LUGS FOR BACKPACKING
 Thanks to a self-cleaning tread with deep lugs specifically designed for carrying midweight loads, the rugged Vibram Apptrail outsole helps you maintain your grip on difficult, uneven terrain. Its pronounced front heel edge reduces your chance of sliding during steep descents. 

TWO-ZONE LACING FOR OPTIMAL FIT
 The Camino's x-lacing with locking eyelets and tongue stud delivers individual heel fit and instep stability. In addition, rubber heel and toe caps make the boot more durable. 

ABOUT LOWA
 Handcrafted in Europe for close to 90 years, LOWA boots have been acclaimed by climbers, mountaineers, and hikers as the finest outdoor boots in the world. LOWA incorporates thoughtful design and superb materials with clean, environmental manufacturing processes and fair labor standards. When you own a pair of LOWAs, you can be confident you're wearing authentic outdoor footwear that "walks the talk" when it comes to quality, performance, and sustainability. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Men's Camino GTX Hiking Boot.

TRADEMARK INFORMATION:
PU Monowrap® Frame

GORE-TEX®

Vibram® Apptrail



For close to 90 years, LOWA boots have been acclaimed by climbers, mountaineers and hikers as the finest outdoor boots in the world. Every LOWA boot is handcrafted in Europe, where they incorporate the elements of thoughtful design, superb materials, clean manufacturing processes and fair labor standards. When you own a pair of LOWAs, you can be confident that you're wearing authentic outdoor footwear that "walks the talk" when it comes to quality, performance and sustainability.
feature_bullets: Supination-Pronation System helps reduce or prevent over-pronation and supination
